intro: Sisyrinchium scabrellum, commonly known as the roughleaf blue-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and delicate blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers bloom in early spring, and the plant is often found in open habitats such as deserts and grasslands. Sisyrinchium scabrellum is an herbaceous perennial that is well adapted to arid environments.
